name: Regions in France
description: Names of the regions in france, both mainland and overseas, as of 2020.

items.name: Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes
items.description: Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes (84) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Lyon and it has an area of 69,711 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Laurent Wauquiez. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Auvergne and Rhône-Alpes.

items.name: Bourgogne-Franche-Comté
items.description: Bourgogne-Franche-Comté (27) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Dijon and it has an area of 47,784 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Marie-Guite Dufay. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Burgundy and Franche-Comté.

items.name: Bretagne
items.description: Bretagne (53) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Rennes and it has an area of 27,208 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Loïg Chesnais-Girard.

items.name: Centre-Val de Loire
items.description: Centre-Val de Loire (24) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Orléans and it has an area of 39,151 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is François Bonneau. Previously, the region consisted of the former region Centre.

items.name: Corse
items.description: Corse (94) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Ajaccio and it has an area of 8,680 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Jean-Guy Talamoni.

items.name: Grand Est
items.description: Grand Est (44) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Strasbourg and it has an area of 57,441 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Jean Rottner. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Alsace, Champagne-Ardenne and Lorraine.

items.name: Hauts-de-France
items.description: Hauts-de-France (32) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Lille and it has an area of 31,806 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Xavier Bertrand. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Nord-Pas-de-Calais and Picardy.

items.name: Île-de-France
items.description: Île-de-France (11) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Paris and it has an area of 12,011 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Valérie Pécresse.

items.name: Normandie
items.description: Normandie (28) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Rouen and it has an area of 29,907 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Hervé Morin. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Upper Normandy and Lower Normandy.

items.name: Nouvelle-Aquitaine
items.description: Nouvelle-Aquitaine (75) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Bordeaux and it has an area of 84,036 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Alain Rousset. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Aquitaine, Limousin and Poitou-Charentes.
spellings: nòva aquitània / nava aquitània / novela aquitània

items.name: Occitanie
items.description: Occitanie (76) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Toulouse and it has an area of 72,724 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Carole Delga. Previously, the region consisted of the former regions Languedoc-Roussillon and Midi-Pyrénées.

items.name: Pays de la Loire
items.description: Pays de la Loire (52) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Nantes and it has an area of 32,082 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Christelle Morançais.

items.name: Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur
items.description: Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur (93) is one of the mainland regions of France. Its capital is Marseille and it has an area of 31,400 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Renaud Muselier.

items.name: Guadeloupe
items.description: Guadeloupe (01) is one of the overseas regions of France. Its capital is Basse-Terre and it has an area of 1,628 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Ary Chalus.

items.name: Guyane
items.description: Guyane (03) is one of the overseas regions of France. Its capital is Cayenne and it has an area of 83,534 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Rodolphe Alexandre.

items.name: La Réunion
items.description: La Réunion (04) is one of the overseas regions of France. Its capital is Saint-Denis and it has an area of 2,504 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Didier Robert.

items.name: Martinique
items.description: Martinique (02) is one of the overseas regions of France. Its capital is Fort-de-France and it has an area of 1,128 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Claude Lise.

items.name: Mayotte
items.description: Mayotte (06) is one of the overseas regions of France. Its capital is Mamoudzou and it has an area of 374 km². The president of the regions as of 2020 is Soibahadine Ibrahim Ramadani.
